tool_description:
The Scraper.io API extracts multiple types of information from the web.

This API is very well suited for rich media apps or websites, since it allows easily extracting both images, text and general article information. It also can be used to render any web page as an image.
name: Scraper
title: Scraper

api_list.name: /v1/render
api_list.description: Renders the given URL in a WebKit-based browser and returns the result as an image.

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description: The URL of the page to render.

optional_parameters.name: vh
optional_parameters.description: The viewport height used for rendering the page. If absent or zero, the viewport will be resized to match the height of the page.

optional_parameters.name: vw
optional_parameters.description: The viewport width used for rendering the page. If absent or zero, the viewport will be resized to match the width of the page.

optional_parameters.name: h
optional_parameters.description: The height to resize the image to.

optional_parameters.name: w
optional_parameters.description: The width to resize the image to.

api_list.name: /v1/text
api_list.description: Returns the article text as a plain text response.

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description: The URL to fetch the article from.

api_list.name: /v1/image
api_list.description: Extracts the most representative image from the given URL. The response body is the image itself. The {w} and {h} parameters can be used to resize the output image to the desired size. If only one of them is non-zero, the image is resized to the given dimension maintaining its aspect ratio. If the new dimensions change the aspect ratio, the image is cropped taking the center portion.

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description: The URL to extract the image from.

optional_parameters.name: w
optional_parameters.description: The width to resize the image to.

optional_parameters.name: h
optional_parameters.description: The height to resize the image to.

api_list.name: /v1/article
api_list.description: Returns information about an article, like it's title, author as well as it's HTML and text representations.

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description: The URL to fetch the article from.

api_list.name: /v1/query
api_list.description: Returns the most appropriate image for the given query. The response body is the image itself. The {w} and {h} parameters can be used to resize the output image to the desired size. If only one of them is non-zero, the image is resized to the given dimension maintaining its aspect ratio. If the new dimensions change the aspect ratio, the image is cropped taking the center portion.

required_parameters.name: q
required_parameters.description: The query used to find the most representative image.

optional_parameters.name: h
optional_parameters.description: The height to resize the image to.

optional_parameters.name: w
optional_parameters.description: The width to resize the image to.
